#summary Get started with cppcheclipse
#labels Featured,Phase-Support

= Introduction =
After the installation you can use these steps to get the first results.

= Get Started =
  # Open Eclipse-Preferences
  # Go to C/C++->cppcheclipse
  # Enter binary path for cppcheclipse
  # Go to settings and select the checks you want to execute (default is check only for problems)
  # Go to problems and deselect the issues you want to suppress
  # Click on OK
  # In the Project Explorer select the project you want to check and right click on it.
  # Select "Run cppcheck" the contextmenu
  # The issues are reported in the problems view
  # For each issue, there are some quickfixes available

  # To configure cppcheck project-specific overwrite some of the settings in the project properties.
